Solar-powered lighting: One idea would be to install solar panels on your roof or nearby surfaces to generate electricity and power LED lights that can be used throughout the day.
Use natural light: Another option would be to make the most of the natural light that is available by opening curtains and blinds and positioning yourself near windows to maximize exposure.
Use artificial lighting: You could also invest in artificial lighting options such as desk lamps, floor lamps, or overhead lights to provide adequate illumination.
Use reflective materials: Another idea would be to use reflective materials such as mirrors or white paint to reflect sunlight into the room, creating a brighter environment.
Use energy-efficient bulbs: Finally, you could switch to energy-efficient bulbs such as LED or CFL bulbs, which use less energy and last longer than traditional incandescent bulbs.
